award.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done
award.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The movie has won a number of awards.
award.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something, especially money, that is officially given to someone as a payment or after a legal decision
award.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Caprio won the award for best actor.
He is the youngest person ever to receive the award.
The award is given each year to the best new artist.
She cried when she was presented with her award.
Four films have been nominated for the award.
The book is up for an award.
Angelina Jolie scooped up the award for best actress.
The poetry award went to Lisa Mueller for ‘Alive Together'.
The Victoria Cross is Britain’s highest military award.
The restaurant has won several top awards.
Their design won a major award at a Paris exhibition.
He received a special award for his work as a movie director.
The Nobel Prize is regarded as the most prestigious award in the world.
The book was nominated for a major US literary award.
My parents wanted to be at the awards ceremony.
The stars are gathering for the annual awards ceremony.
The award winners will be announced in December.
The league started a new award scheme for young players.
award.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
award.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
The judge awarded me first prize.
A Nobel Prize was awarded to Waksman in 1952.
award.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to officially decide that someone should receive a payment or a formal agreement
award.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The government awarded a German company the contract.
£45,000 was awarded to a typist with an injured hand.
award.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: an amount of money that is given to someone as a result of an official decision or judgment
award.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: the basic award for unfair dismissal
The nurses’ pay award (=increase in pay) was not nearly as much as they had expected.
award.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: something such as a prize or an amount of money given to a person or company to reward them for something they have done
award.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: 85% of the company’s product is sold overseas, a feat which won it the Queen’s Award for Export.
award.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to officially decide that someone should have something such as an amount of money
award.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: We were naturally delighted to be awarded this contract.
The tribunal can award you compensation or order your reinstatement.
award.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to officially give a prize or an amount of money to a person or company, to reward them for what they have done
award.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: He has been awarded the MBE for services to the electricity supply industry.
The university awarded her a scholarship.
